title: If we removed Yasuo's dash-q.
body:
Would it make him less frustrating to play against? I think so.

Not only do you have to aim his Q no matter what in this case, but to get the knock up, you gotta land the skillshot. No exceptions.

Not only do you have to land the skill shot in this case, but part of what makes his ranged Q more or less balanced is the cast time it has. You have a lot  of extra time to flash or dash it, or hell, even to just dodge it. E-Q is just basically undodgeable by almost any means. That leads to a free ult, another free Q, and a free auto attack.

I feel it's a good place to start without directly touching any numbers.

They'd have to revert the speed cap on his Q and give him back his W passive. Those are the things Riot took away because they made his overbearing. Yo, this is the height of putting the cart before the horse.

Statistically speaking, if you are a Yasuo player, you are not playing Yasuo right now and really haven't been for months. Not being open to non-numerical changes is how champions get absolutely guttered and then eventually reworked into shadows of their former selves.

No matter how you look at it, something has got to give mechanically for Yasuo or he will be functionally deleted and re-released with the same name.

There isn't anything about yasuo's kit that's inherently broken or degenerate, so the odds of him getting a relaunch are unlikely at best. Opponent frustration is basically built into his kit, given the amount of agency he possesses. If lowering frustration is the goal, then  we need solutions more elegant than outright removing a mechanic from his kit, be it through numbers or changes like the recent one to his ult.

Well said @IronWallJackson. His Kit isn't a mage's kit whom you can just change the skill and problem solved, If they remove the E/Q mechanic, They'll need to rework his whole kit. Yasuo's kit is really nice and fits well with his theme from P to Ult. Just like Kennen.

Exactly. Yasuo has one of those rare champions whose kit is really interconnected, so when you mess with one thing, a bunch of others tend to be affected. If you remove something entirely, it would cease to be a cohesive, working whole.
P.S Yasuo Ban rate is 36%.

As long as you can E into an enemy champion, you can fire off your Q at point blank range. Removing the ability to E+Q will end up being a weird nerf that doesn't do much of anything in lane, since Q would just buffer and fire out as soon as E'd dash ends, but would make it much much harder to hit multiple targets with your knockup. This change would only matter post-laning phase, so yasuo's opponents would still be buttflustered and yasuo's players would get to join their buttfrustration. 

This change doesn't make anyone happy, does it?

I disagree. Probably the biggest frustration as a melee character against him is his ability to charge up a 3rd Q, then E E E-Q E E E away with no real way to dodge it or retaliate against him. His dash is non-homing. It always goes to a specific distance and direction based on his and his opponents start position. He would have to choose which direction he fired the Q, and instead of 0 cast time you get .25 seconds to react.

His tornado Q is far far more awkward to hit, even close range than his dash-Q. Even the base dash-q is also more powerful than the regular base Q in terms of AoE hit. It removes a LOT of skill from playing him.

I'll pretend that I agree with you for now. You want to remove something you feel lowers Yasuo's skill floor and taken away some opponent frustration (maybe). Now there's a need for compensation buffs. By removing E+Q, his engage is less reliable, his ult is less reliable, his waveclear's taken huge hit, and raised the skill burden on the player. What do you do about all the collateral damage and the gap it's left in his power budget?
